{{short description|Chain of retail stores and online shopping site operated by Microsoft}} {{For|Microsoft Store on Windows and Xbox One|Microsoft Store (digital)}} {{Infobox company | name = Microsoft Store | logo = M_box.svg | logo_size = 100px | image = | image_caption = | type = [[Subsidiary]] | genre = | industry = {{plainlist| * [[Computer hardware]] * [[Software|Computer software]] * [[Consumer electronics]] * [[Distribution (business)|Distribution]] }} | foundation = {{Start date and age|2009|10|22}} | locations = {{Collapsible list | title = World: 116 stores in 4 countries and 1 territory{{cite web |title=Store List - Microsoft Store |url=https://www.microsoft.com/en-us/store/locations/all-locations |website=[[Microsoft]] |accessdate=September 24, 2017}}
{{small|(107 US/10 overseas)}} | 1 = United States: 106 | 2 = Canada: 8 | 3 = Australia: 1 | 4 = United Kingdom: 1 | 5 = Puerto Rico: 1 }} | key_people = {{plainlist| * [[Satya Nadella]] ([[Chief executive officer|CEO]]) }} | products = {{plainlist| * [[Microsoft Surface|Surface]] * [[Xbox]] * [[Virtual Reality]] * [[Windows 10]] * [[Office 365]] * Microsoft & third-party [[software]] and accessories *Computer Repair }} | parent = [[Microsoft Corporation|Microsoft]] | homepage = {{URL|https://www.microsoftstore.com/}} | closed = }} [[File:Microsoft Store Front.jpg|thumb|A Microsoft Store bearing the 2009–2012 logo]] [[File:TorontoMicrosoftStore8.JPG|thumb|Microsoft Store in Yorkdale, Toronto, the first store located outside the U.S.]] [[File:Microsoft Store in Sydney 2017.jpg|thumb|Microsoft Store in Sydney]] '''Microsoft Store''' is a chain of [[retailer|retail stores]] and an [[Microsoft Store (digital)|online shopping site]], owned and operated by [[Microsoft]] and dealing in computers, computer software, and consumer electronics. The Microsoft Store offers Signature PCs and [[Tablet computer|tablets]] like the [[Microsoft Surface]], and offerings from third parties such as [[Acer Inc.|Acer]], [[Dell]], [[HP Inc.|HP]], [[Lenovo]], and [[VAIO]] without demos nor trialware (pre-installed free trials of certain third-party software that expire after a limited time). It also offers [[Microsoft Windows|Windows]] (most retail versions), [[Microsoft Office]], and [[Xbox One]] game consoles, games, and services including on-site Xbox diagnostics. The Answers Desk helps to answer questions related to Office, Windows, and other Microsoft products; the stores also offer class sessions as well as individual appointments. The first two Microsoft Stores opened within a week of the [[Windows 7]] launch, in [[Scottsdale, Arizona]] and [[Mission Viejo, California]].{{cite web | url=https://twitter.com/Microsoft/status/3182313977 | title=Behind these walls in Scottsdale & Mission Viejo, the first Microsoft retail stores | author=Microsoft News | website=Twitter | date=2009-08-07 | accessdate=2010-11-28}} Additional stores have since opened in California, Colorado, Florida, Georgia, Illinois, Minnesota, Missouri, Texas, and Washington. At the 2011 [[Professional Developers Conference]], Microsoft announced that they intend to open 75 new stores in the next three years.{{cite news| url= http://news.cnet.com/8301-10805_3-20079207-75/microsoft-will-open-75-new-stores-within-3-years/|title= Microsoft will open 75 new stores within 3 years|work=CNET News}} The first store outside the U.S. (and the first of eight stores in Canada) opened in [[Toronto]] on November 16, 2012,{{cite news|url=https://www.thestar.com/business/article/1288149--microsoft-s-first-canadian-retail-store-to-open-at-yorkdale-sneak-peek|title=Microsoft’s first Canadian retail store to open at Yorkdale: Sneak peek|last=Kopun|first=Francine|date=15 November 2012|work=[[Toronto Star]]|accessdate=10 December 2012}} while the first store outside North America (and first store in [[Asia-Pacific]] and second flagship store{{cite press release | url=http://www.techly.com.au/2015/11/12/microsofts-sydney-flagship-store-first-look-at-a-massive-new-focus-on-service/ | title= Microsoft's Sydney Flagship Store: The Massive New Focus on Service | date=2015-11-12 | publisher=Techly | accessdate=2015-11-14}}) opened in [[Sydney]], [[Australia]] on November 12, 2015.{{cite press release | url=http://news.microsoft.com/en-au/2015/04/21/all-eyes-on-australia-first-microsoft-flagship-store-in-asia-pacific-lands-in-sydney/ | title= All eyes on Australia: First Microsoft flagship store in Asia Pacific lands in Sydney | date=2015-04-21 | publisher=Microsoft | accessdate=2015-04-21}} In September 2017, the company announced a store on [[Regent Street]] in [[London]], [[England]].{{Cite web|url=https://www.windowscentral.com/microsoft-expected-open-its-first-uk-store-london|title=Microsoft to open its first UK retail store in London [Updated]|last=Brown|first=Matt|date=21 September 2017|website=Windows Central|access-date=21 September 2017}} ==History== Microsoft's first retail store was located in the [[Metreon]] in [[San Francisco]]. It was owned and operated by Sony Retail Entertainment{{cite press release | url=http://www.microsoft.com/presspass/press/1999/Jun99/microsoftSFpr.mspx | title= Microsoft Debuts microsoftSF Retail Environment At San Francisco's Metreon Sony Entertainment Center | date=1999-06-16 | publisher=Microsoft | accessdate=2010-11-28}} and ran from 1999{{cite news | url=http://www.salon.com/technology/feature/1999/06/29/microsoft_store/ | title=The consumer incarnation of Microsoftiness | last=Brown | first=Janelle | date=1999-06-29 | accessdate=2010-11-28 | work=Salon}} to 2001.{{cite news | url=http://news.cnet.com/Xbox-due,-Microsoft-exits-Sony-owned-mall/2100-1040_3-275258.html | title=Xbox due, Microsoft exits Sony-owned mall | first=Sandeep | last=Junnarkar | date=2001-11-01 | accessdate=2010-11-28 | work=CNET News}} In 2009, Microsoft built a "Retail Experience Center" in their [[Redmond, Washington]] headquarters{{cite news | url=https://www.engadget.com/2009/01/13/microsoft-builds-pretend-retail-store-wants-to-play-house-later/ | title=Microsoft builds pretend retail store, wants to play house later | last=Miller | first=Paul | date=2009-01-13 | work=Engadget | accessdate=2010-11-28}} and announced plans to build its own retail stores.{{cite news | url=http://www.maximumpc.com/article/news/its_official_microsoft_brand_store_fronts_coming_soon | title=It's Official: Microsoft Brand Store Fronts Coming Soon | date=2009-02-13 | first=Paul | last=Lilly | work=MaximumPC | accessdate=2010-11-28}} On October 22, 2009, the same day as the Windows 7 launch, Microsoft opened a retail store in [[Scottsdale, Arizona]]. A week later, another opened in [[Mission Viejo, California]]. Five additional stores were opened in 2010. A ninth store opened in [[Atlanta, Georgia|Atlanta]] in May 2011, with two more openings planned in [[Houston]] and [[Los Angeles]] by the end of June. ==Shopping experience== The Microsoft Store is similar to the popular [[Apple Store]] concept, which has been largely successful.{{cite news |url=http://articles.latimes.com/print/2010/nov/26/business/la-fi-microsoft-stores-20101126 |title=For some, the Microsoft Store concept is a puzzle |work=Los Angeles Times | date=2010-11-26 | first=Nathan |last=Olivarez-Giles | accessdate=2011-01-09}} The concept aims to give a greater level of customer satisfaction both by only having sales staff as well as by employing "Technical Advisers" (similar to Apple's "[[Genius Bar|Geniuses]]") to assist customers with technical questions and issues. In addition, "Specialists" (or trainers) are employed to show customers how to get the most out of their software. [[Xbox One]] consoles are also available to entertain patrons. ==Retail locations== [[File:Microsoft Store locations in the US.svg|thumb|Map of Microsoft Store locations in the United States]] There are Microsoft Store retail locations throughout the US, seven in Canada, one in [[Sydney, Australia]], and one in [[London, England]]. Microsoft Store formerly operated a store in [[Helsinki, Finland]]. == Other formats == === Microsoft Specialty Stores === In May 2013, Microsoft began to launch [[mall kiosk]] locations known as '''Microsoft Specialty Stores''', expanding upon the Surface-focused [[pop-up store]]s established during the launch of [[Windows 8]]. They featured a smaller product offering, with a particular focus on the Surface and [[Windows Phone]] product lines. In June 2019, Microsoft closed all Specialty Store locations. {{cite web|title=Microsoft continues its kiosk kick, will open new 'specialty stores'|url=http://www.cnet.com/news/microsoft-continues-its-kiosk-kick-will-open-new-specialty-stores/|website=CNET News|accessdate=30 July 2015}} === Best Buy Windows Stores === On June 13, 2013, Microsoft announced a partnership with the [[Best Buy]] chain to replace their Best Buy's PC departments with '''The Windows Store''' (unrelated to the [[Windows Store]] software distribution platform) at 600 locations in the United States and Canada, by September 2013. The [[store-within-a-store]] showcases Windows devices, Microsoft hardware and software products (including the Office, Surface, and Xbox lines). Departments for other manufacturers (such as [[Apple Inc.|Apple]], [[Google]], and [[Samsung]]) remain separate from the Windows Store sections. Best Buy also pledged to add 1,200 Microsoft-trained sales associates to its stores and to stock more accessories for Microsoft-related products, such as [[Windows Phone]] devices.{{cite web|title=Microsoft to launch dedicated Windows stores in Best Buys|url=http://www.zdnet.com/microsoft-to-launch-dedicated-windows-stores-in-best-buys-7000016806/|website=ZDNet|accessdate=14 June 2013}} == See also == * [[Apple Store]] * [[Google Store]] ==References== {{Reflist|2}} ==External links== {{Commons category}} *{{Official website|2=Microsoft Store Online}} *[http://www.microsoft.com/en-us/store/locations/find-a-store Microsoft Store Locations] *{{cite web| url=https://gizmodo.com/5322328/leak-inside-the-microsoft-store-with-wall+sized-screens-and-the-answers-bar/|website= Gizmodo|title= Microsoft Store Concepts}} {{Microsoft|state=collapsed}} [[Category:Best Buy]] [[Category:Microsoft divisions]] [[Category:American companies established in 2009]] [[Category:Retail companies established in 2009]] [[Category:Consumer electronics retailers in the United States]]
